results.title: A Scenic harvest from the kingdom of pain
results.creator_credit: Joe Rees, Jonathan Reiss, IKON (GB) and Target Video
results.brief_description: Follows the performance art group Survival Research Laboratories and records three performances of the group. The setting up for a performance is shown, and interviews with some of the members of the group are conducted. The video also reports on whether injuries by the audience or performers were sustained.

results.title: A Scanner Darkly
results.brief_description: An undercover cop in a not-too-distant future becomes involved with a dangerous new drug and begins to lose his own identity as a result.
results.description: An undercover cop in a not-too-distant future becomes involved with a dangerous new drug and begins to lose his own identity as a result.

results.title: A Scaley situation
results.creator_credit: Mark Laughlin, James Mann and Education Department of Victoria for Zoo Education Services
results.brief_description: Linda Roach interviews Chris Banks, Keeper in Charge and Jon Birkett from the Melbourne Zoo who outline the physical characteristics of various reptiles. Illustrates first aid for venomous reptile bites. Warning: Some scenes depict zoo animals feeding. Parents and teachers are advised that some of these scenes may upset young children.

results.title: A Say in your community with the Australian Assistance Plan
results.brief_description: Made for he Social Welfare Commission and Department of Social welfare, the film explains the concept and illustrates the benefits available to community groups throughout Australia under the Australian Assistance Plan, a revolutionary concept in the identification of community need areas.

results.title: A Saucer of water for the birds
results.brief_description: An animated short. A woman and her grandmother sit together playing cards. As they are shuffled and dealt, the film cuts between pre-war Poland, Europe during the Holocaust, the woman’s childhood, and the present. A meditation on the relationship between public history and personal memory, as it is played out in the dynamics of the family.

images.caption: A Saucer Of Water For The Birds VHS slick image

results.title: A Saucer of water for the birds
results.brief_description: The unusual technique of sand animation is used to tell the story of a woman and her granddaughter. It starts with them sitting at the kitchen table playing cards. As the cards are shuffled and cut, the film cuts between pre-war Poland, Europe in the Holocaust, the woman’s childhood and the present. The old woman’s homeland is evoked as a world the child strives to create from anecdotes. The woman’s present is shown as one etched with darkness of her family’s experience of the Holocaust.
results.title_for_label: A Saucer of water for the birds

results.title: A Salute to Mel Blanc
results.brief_description: This is a tribute collection of classic cartoons dedicated to the remarkable voice of Mel Blanc. He was the voice of so many well known cartoon characters including Bugs Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Pepe Le Pew, Yosemite Sam, Tweety and Sylvester and each of these selected cartoons features at least one of Mel Blanc’s characterisations. Interestingly, the dialogue was recorded before the animators did their work meaning that Mel Blanc had to imagine and create the action from a series of sketches. This is no mean feat and requires a lot of skill and energy. Mel Blanc died in 1989 but his voice lives on in the much-loved Looney Tunes and Merrie Melodies cartoons which are still showing around the world today. Suitable viewing for all the family.

results.title: A Salute to Friz Freleng
results.creator_credit: Isadore Freleng and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Born Isadore Freleng in 1906 in Missouri (died 1995) but better known as Friz Freleng, this Academy Award winner cartoonist/animator joined Warner Bros studios as head animator in 1930 and it is here that he created the majority of his over 300 cartoons, mainly for Merrie Melodies and Looney Tunes. His brand of humour and whacky cartoon characters are loved and adored world-wide and across all age groups. This video pays tribute to Freleng by showing eight of his more prominent and well-known cartoons mainly from the 1950s period and include those evergreen favourites Sylvester and Tweety, Bugs Bunny, Yosemite Sam, and Speedy Gonzales. Three of the eight cartoons shown are Oscar winners: “Birds anonymous”, “Speedy Gonzales” and “Knighty knight Bugs”.

results.title: A Salute to Billie Holiday = A Tribute to Billie Holiday
results.brief_description: Performed live at the Hollywood Bowl, this made for television production features five highly acclaimed and recognised American female jazz and blues singers who present their own unique interpretations of several memorable songs by legendary blues singer, Billie Holiday. Set to a 32-piece orchestra, arranged and conducted by Ray Ellis, these five wonderful women, Maxine Weldon, Morgana King, Carmen McCrae, Nina Simone and Esther Phillips, each give a stunning performance climaxing with all five singing together on stage. The program is interspersed with two pieces of rare archival footage (1935 and 1950) of the “Lady” in action along with personal commentary by Maxine Weldon and Morgana King. Great music and of historical value. NB: Picture and sound quality poor but still worth viewing.
